subject: Tour de France (Bicycle Race)
Bicycles and Bicycling
Steroids
lead_paragraph: Alexander Vinokourov, one of the favorites to win this year’s Tour de France, acknowledged he had used the services of the Italian doctor Michele Ferrari, but not for medical products.Ferrari, who once advised Lance Armstrong, was found guilty of fraud and malpractice in 2004 but was acquitted on charges of distributing doping products. He won an appeal two years later.Vinokourov, the leader of the Astana team, said Ferrari never offered him medication. “Michele Ferrari is a physical trainer but not my doctor,” Vinokourov said in the French newspaper L’Equipe.
